content: black onto side of the shoe of the first workable row 4 single_crochet left unworked and single_crochet across slip stitching into the opposite side of the top of the shoe 4 row 2 turn and slip_stitch into the side of the shoe in the next row to be worked moving up the side of the shoe and across the upper part where the sock shows single_crochet across slip stitching into the opposite side of the top shoe to finish off knot and break yarn one black stripe made 4 row 3 repeat row 1 with white row 4 repeat row 2 with white row 5 repeat row 1 with black row 6 join black yarn to the back seam of the shoe chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around the of the shoe and the front part of the sock join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 7 join white yarn chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 8 chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 9 with black chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 10 chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 11 with white chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch row 12 chain 1 and single_crochet into the same stitch single_crochet around join to first single_crochet with a slip_stitch repeat row 9­12 until sock reaches desired length and then stuff and finish off
